intro: Chrysanthemum modestum, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Chrysanthemum modestum is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional medicine.
